meanings.definition: The act of ceasing or stopping something.
meanings.sent1: After many warnings, the desistances of the noisy party finally brought peace to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The desistances of the construction work allowed the residents to enjoy a quiet evening.
meanings.sent3: The desistances of the barking dog made the whole street breathe a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent4: Her desistances from eating sweets were like a sudden break in a continuous stream of indulgence.
meanings.sent5: The desistances of the rain brought out a rainbow, signaling the end of the storm.

meanings.definition: The state of refraining from continuing an action.
meanings.sent1: His desistances from arguing with his brother improved their relationship.
meanings.sent2: The desistances of the child from touching the hot stove prevented an accident.
meanings.sent3: The desistances of the cat from chasing the mouse left the little rodent puzzled.
meanings.sent4: In the silence of her desistances, her true feelings spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The desistances of the runner just before the finish line surprised everyone watching.
